description.narrative: 5.2. Adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have access to evidence-based, integrated, innovative initiatives to promote their participation and engagement, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, a mobilized society drives public action that accelerates the realization of the rights of children and adolescents, especially for those most disadvantaged.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.2. Adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have access to evidence-based, integrated, innovative initiatives to promotetheir participation and engagement

description.narrative: UNICEF promoted initiatives for adolescents to exercise their rights to an active participation in issues that affect them, in a context of digital hyper connection deepened by the pandemic, motivating them and giving them tools to talk about different concerns related to their well-being. In relation to this, UNICEF promoted the Generation Unlimited project which objective is to guarantee the continuity of learning and social inclusion of adolescents living in rural areas. Currently, around 871,.571 adolescents were mobilized in activities to promote their rights during the first six months of 2021 and more than 4.3M during the period 2016-2021 | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/08/2021
